Header: Boris rises from the ditch for Halloween
Content: It is the Eve of all Hallows, the ghouls are out and about, Brexit hasn’t happened and Boris Johnson is dead in a ditch.Except Boris isn’t dead. He has survived, to ‘rise like a political viagra’ to take Britain forward with a ‘lots of ladies at his side.’The UK’s real prime minister announced in November that he would rather be ‘dead in a ditch’ than ask for a delay to the UK leaving the EU by October 31.A London venue had planned to celebrate Brexit as part of an immersive War of the World’s experience organised by creative director of dotdotdot Dominic Wong. In War of the Worlds martians attack and people are faced with the end of the world. It seemed a good fit for the end of Britain’s road with Europe.On Thursday as Londoners celebrated Halloween, the world hadn’t ended and Britain was still in the EU, “the Brexit has been going on for so long.
